title: Jordan Henderson responds to vile racist abuse from Bulgarian fans during England win
text:

Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson said he was 'disgusted' by the racist abuse England's black players suffered during their 6-0 win over Bulgaria on Monday night.

The likes of Tyrone Mings, Raheem Sterling and Marcus Rashford were targeted by some home supporters, who engaged in monkey chants and Nazi gestures in sickening scenes .

The match was stopped twice in the first-half as a result of the abuse but England players decided to carry on and finish the game, and Henderson has praised his teammates for their response.

Posting on his social media Henderson said: "Absolutely disgusted to have witnessed the behaviour of some of the crowd tonight but so proud of every single one of our players and staff. We stand together. Thanks to all of our travelling fans for your support."

(Image: PA)

He also included a picture of the squad taken before the game, with Henderson holding a sign that read "#Equalgame".

He quickly received support for his message, with one Twitter user replying: "Well done to the players and staff who acted professionally in the face of such abuse this evening", while another added "Massive respect to the whole England team."

Other England players also had their say on the shameful scenes through social media. Rashford posted on his accounts and said: "Not an easy situation to play in and not one which should be happening in 2019. Proud we rose above it to take three points but this needs stamping out."

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Sterling added: "Feeling sorry for Bulgaria to be represented by such idiots in their stadium. Anyway.. 6-0 and we go back home, at least we did our job. Safe travel to our fans, u guys did well."

The likes of manager Gareth Southgate and FA chairman Greg Clarke have called on UEFA to punish Bulgaria in the strongest way possible following the disgraceful events of the match.
description: England's black players were targeted by some of the home supporters during the 6-0 victory in Sofia
